intro: Lopholaena segmentata, commonly known as the segmented lopholaena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
